author: BioPhoenix

text: Always liked this calm, funky battle theme with great bass. I have no idea what Tamsoft is up to these days, but it feels like the Battle Arena Toshinden series and this game were their best accomplishments. This game was certainly a fun, light hearted RPG.
author: SupraDarky

text: yeah the graphics were the worse but the charecter made up for it and drew you in like rpgs fail to these days.like how every single drawer/object could be observed with uniqe qualities.I am shock to say it is one of my favorite rpgs.meanwhile i still haven't beaten the first ff13 because it is just so boring
author: Seti Amon

text:
Haha, battle music with this kind of feeling kind of makes me think of the normal battle theme from an old SNES game, Gokinjo Boukentai.

Well, maybe I should say old Super Famicom game since it was never brought over from Japan.

Battle themes like this are nice and easy to listen to.
Which is good in Guardian's Crusade's case since you'd be hearing it a whole bunch.
author: Iyasenu

text: Am I the only one getting a Michael Jackson vibe from this battle theme? Sounds kinda like Bad or Smooth Criminal.
author: Faldomar

text: @SupraDarky I love how it turns from a "chill" funky battle theme into a racing nervous pump theme if you play it at 1.25x speed. Simply a great track.
author: Vicen Jm

text: @SupraDarky Sadly for Tamsoft, nowadays they only makes Hentai or Erotic themed games... rarely seeing rpg coming out from them, maybe one day they will realize the potential of simple style rpg game or making a sequel of this, would love it.
author: Dread84624

text: +SupraDarky That. Blows. My. MIND. I did not know those two were related, and funnily enough I played both!! BA Toshiden was also fun as heck! Thank you for allowing me to come to this little revelation.
